revised_title: Extensional Tectonics in Central and Eastern Asia: A Comprehensive Overview
tldr: This article discusses the extensional tectonics in central and eastern Asia, which are mainly due to the collision and continued convergence between India and Eurasia. The author explains that extensional tectonics occur in four regions: Tibet, the Baikal rift system, the Shansi graben, and Yunnan. The article also explores the different mechanisms responsible for the extension in these regions and their relation to the convergence between India and Eurasia.
